intro: Peckia verticillata, commonly known as the whorled peckia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive inflorescence. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves arranged in whorls around the stem, giving it a unique appearance. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Peckia verticillata is often found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and pine flatwoods.
